captions.text:
NINA NARRATING: I had the
craziest dream last night

about a girl who was
turned into a swan.

But her prince falls
for the wrong girl,

And you're the most dedicated
dancer in the company.

-Our new Swan Queen, the
exquisite Nina Sayers.

-I don't want to talk
about that.
I knew it'd be too much.
-How do you know where I live?

ERICA (OFFSCREEN): What happened
to my sweet girl?

comments.text:
@keenoled possibly because the creepy stuff that is creepy for adults 
usually has more to do with internal fears, and the creepy stuff for kids 
is external. This film is chocked full of internal fears, manifesting as 
fairly tame external ones. Do I think its a movie for kids? No, but I see 
how it would be less freaky for a ten year old than for a thirty year old, 
and all ten year olds wanna watch a scary movie sometimes.

comments.text:
I've been a ballet dancer for 12 years, and I absolutely adore this movie. 
Natalie Portman did an amazing job potraying the psycological struggles 
ballet dancers go through, and the way they strive for perfection. I think 
the dancing was beautiful, and the story has stayed with me since the day I 
watched it.

comments.text:
It was a pretty intense movie, I felt drained by the end. But her character 
wasn't likeable. She was a self absorbed psychologically underdeveloped 
woman and stayed that way through the whole movie. But I guess mental 
illness can make some people self absorbed. Anyway I think the story line 
is very good but I honestly couldn't stand her character.

comments.text:
I﻿ think this film is like cat people for the thicker generation, which is 
fine, i'm actually learning to deal with it. Most people haven't grown up 
watching bravo, sci-fi movies like swamp thing etc so I can undersatnd how 
this sort of Bmovie has an allure for those that are on a diet of films 
like inception, 21 century MTV, Gossip girl and things alike. 4u this is 
something new and seductive. For Natalie's sake though I hope she doesn't 
win so it'll force her to be less of an uptight actress.

comments.text:
SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER: i absolutely LOVE 
transformation movies. but with this one, the great thing was the 
psychological level it was on, especially during parts when you think its 
real and then you have to come to terms that later on, you were just 
visiting nina's crazy side. yet again, i don't think she was "crazy". she 
was just too dedicated. the teacher said she was always TOO perfect, so she 
let go of herself piece by piece as the story went on! GREAT FILM
